title: Oracle WebLogic Server ForeignOpaqueReference JNDI Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Oracle WebLogic Server. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the ForeignOpaqueReference class. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in execution of arbitrary Java code. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the service account.
addtionnal_details: Oracle has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2023.html
timeline:
2022-09-20 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2023-02-09 - Coordinated public release of advisory
